channel.title: Apache + PHP + MySql + Filezilla (ftp) + Mercury (smtp)
channel.description:
Apache friends' XAMPP, i think it's an awesome program i had to share with you.[right][img]http://static.apachefriends.org/images/193.jpg[/img][/right]
[hr] Many people know from their own experience that it's not easy to install an Apache web server and it gets harder if you want to add MySQL, PHP and Perl. XAMPP is an easy to install Apache distribution containing MySQL, PHP and Perl. XAMPP is really very easy to install and to use - just download, extract and start. At the moment there are four XAMPP versions:
- a version for Linux systems (tested for Ubuntu, SuSE, RedHat, Mandrake and Debian), - a version for Windows 98, NT, 2000, 2003 and XP, - a beta version for Solaris SPARC (developed and tested under Solaris 8), - and a beta version for MacOS X. This MacOSX and Solaris versions of XAMPP are still in the first steps of development. [hr]
[b]Download:[/b] [img]http://www.apachefriends.org/img/link.gif[/img] [url=http://www.apachefriends.org/download.php?xampp-win32-1.5.3a-installer.exe]http://www.apachefriends.org/download.php?xampp-win32-1.5.3a-installer.exe[/url] (win32) [img]http://www.apachefriends.org/img/link.gif[/img] [url=http://www.apachefriends.org/download.php?xampp-linux-1.5.3a.tar.gz]http://www.apachefriends.org/download.php?xampp-linux-1.5.3a.tar.gz[/url] (linux) [img]http://www.apachefriends.org/img/link.gif[/img] [url=http://www.apachefriends.org/download.php?xampp-macosx-0.5.pkg.sitx]http://www.apachefriends.org/download.php?xampp-macosx-0.5.pkg.sitx[/url] (Max OS X) [img]http://www.apachefriends.org/img/link.gif[/img] [url=http://www.apachefriends.org/download.php?xampp-solaris-0.8.1.sh]http://www.apachefriends.org/download.php?xampp-solaris-0.8.1.sh[/url] (Solaris)
[b]Instructions:[/b] Please go to http://www.apachefriends.org/en/xampp.html and press the OS you are running. You'll find everything you'll need there ;) :D
Hope you're enjoying it!! :D
~S!ms

item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

it is ment to be simple, you can edit the code just like apache, but you can also do automated things, through the consol, you can set up php without any difficulty what so ever, you just have to browse the for the file, then you set up the extentions, and it works, it has a non-hacking thing, here i will just get some pictures on my next meged post[br][size=1]Posted at: August 31, 2006, 07:03:03 PM[/size][hr][flash=540,400]http://abs.gprime.net/picturet.swf[/flash]

there

item.title: Apache + PHP + MySql + Filezilla (ftp) + Mercury (smtp)
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

well I run XAMPP but i don’t run apache from it, i only run mySQL from it because its the only MySQL that works for me, im trying to figure out how to make mercury work and stuff though. I use abyss webserver(really easy, has its own GUI and everything, There is a consol option that u can actualy go around in icons, and change settings, in apache you have to try to find it in all the code, abyss has code but it configures it’s self.

Read full topic

item.title: Apache + PHP + MySql + Filezilla (ftp) + Mercury (smtp)
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

i am trying to use an invision pawerboard thingy from the tutorials/tweaks/etc. and I get this stupid error, i know i am almost there(as in setting up the forum thing on my webserver) and here is the error

Warning!

The following errors must be rectified before continuing!
Please go back and try again!

INSERT INTO ibf_task_manager VALUES (’’, ‘Update Topic Views Counter’, ‘updateviews.php’, 1156307250, -1, -1, 3, -1, ‘ddce954b5ba1c163bc627ca20725b595’, 0, ‘Used when topic views are not incremented immediately’, 1, ‘updateviews’, 0, 0);

Out of range value adjusted for column ‘task_id’ at row 1

which I don’t know how to get to ibf task manager, or even where, or how to inisert it in, anybody have a solution to this?

Read full topic

item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

These kinds of programs are cheating though - you gotta set it up youself

But from what I’ve heard XAMPP is very good - I tried out another similar package called PHPDev years ago, but I actually found it much easier to configure it myself, so I stuck with it…

item.title: Apache + PHP + MySql + Filezilla (ftp) + Mercury (smtp)
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

Apache friends’ XAMPP, i think it’s an awesome program i had to share with you.[right][/right]

[hr]
Many people know from their own experience that it’s not easy to install an Apache web server and it gets harder if you want to add MySQL, PHP and Perl. XAMPP is an easy to install Apache distribution containing MySQL, PHP and Perl. XAMPP is really very easy to install and to use - just download, extract and start.
At the moment there are four XAMPP versions:

  • a version for Linux systems (tested for Ubuntu, SuSE, RedHat, Mandrake and Debian),
  • a version for Windows 98, NT, 2000, 2003 and XP,
  • a beta version for Solaris SPARC (developed and tested under Solaris 8),
  • and a beta version for MacOS X.
    This MacOSX and Solaris versions of XAMPP are still in the first steps of development.
    [hr]

Download:
http://www.apachefriends.org/download.php?xampp-win32-1.5.3a-installer.exe (win32)
http://www.apachefriends.org/download.php?xampp-linux-1.5.3a.tar.gz (linux)
http://www.apachefriends.org/download.php?xampp-macosx-0.5.pkg.sitx (Max OS X)
http://www.apachefriends.org/download.php?xampp-solaris-0.8.1.sh (Solaris)

Instructions:
Please go to http://www.apachefriends.org/en/xampp.html and press the OS you are running. You’ll find everything you’ll need there

Hope you’re enjoying it!!

~S!ms
